intro: Asperula aristata f. scabra, commonly known as the scabrous woodruff, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant features hairy, scabrous leaves that give it its specific epithet, and it typically grows in shaded, moist environments. It is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
